R.content: fidelity to come, to the to-come, to the future, always trembling, risky, is held in friendship, friendship of thought: yes, there is friendship to (be) thought: oui, il y a de l’amitié à penser > we are guests to this snaking oath (serment) [D.H. Lawrence], in name of democracy
R.linkedContent: fidelity to come, to the to-come, to the future, always trembling, risky, is held in friendship, friendship of thought: yes, there is friendship to (be) thought: oui, il y a de l’amitié à penser > we are guests to this snaking oath (serment) [D.H. Lawrence], in name of democracy

R.content: [re: Greek word democracy] heirs, legatees, the legacy & the allegation (play btwn legare & legere), “sending or putting off (renvoi) gestures toward the past of an inheritance only by remaining to come”
R.linkedContent: [re: Greek word democracy] heirs, legatees, the legacy & the allegation (play btwn legare & legere), “sending or putting off (renvoi) gestures toward the past of an inheritance only by remaining to come”

R.content: structure of a promise: the memory of that which carries the future, the to-come, here and now
R.linkedContent: structure of a promise: the memory of that which carries the future, the to-come, here and now

R.content: to think democracy [Paulhan], to think “first to happen by (le premier venue),” at limit of “who” or “what,” living being, cadaver > “first to happen by” = “first to come”?
R.linkedContent: to think democracy [Paulhan], to think “first to happen by (le premier venue),” at limit of “who” or “what,” living being, cadaver > “first to happen by” = “first to come”?

R.content: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure  (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, heteronomy and autonomy, indivisible sovereignty and divisible or shared sovereignty, a despairing messianicity)
R.linkedContent: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, heteronomy and autonomy, indivisible sovereignty and divisible or shared sovereignty, a despairing messianicity)

R.content: invention not of the event but through it
R.linkedContent: invention not of the event but through it

R.content: “to” of “to-come” wavers btwn: imperative injunction (call or performative) and patient perhaps of messiancity (nonperformative exposure)
R.linkedContent: “to” of “to-come” wavers btwn: imperative injunction (call or performative) and patient perhaps of messiancity (nonperformative exposure)

R.content: the two haunt each other, are each other’s alibis, withdrawing into the secret of irony, of which democracy gives the right: to fiction and literature
R.linkedContent: the two haunt each other, are each other’s alibis, withdrawing into the secret of irony, of which democracy gives the right: to fiction and literature

R.content: [Derrida on 9/11]: not as unforeseeable as everyone claimed; the trauma that occurred, not what actually happened, but apprehension of a worse threat still to come
R.linkedContent: [Derrida on 9/11]: not as unforeseeable as everyone claimed; the trauma that occurred, not what actually happened, but apprehension of a worse threat still to come

R.content: urgency and imminence of to-come: the à of à-venir inflecting into injunction, and into messianic waiting the a of différance
R.linkedContent: urgency and imminence of to-come: the à of à-venir inflecting into injunction, and into messianic waiting the a of différance

R.content: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]; “democracy to come—salut!”
R.linkedContent: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]; “democracy to come—salut!”

MONL.content: I always surrender myself to language: give credit to that which is to come (as opposed to the given)
MONL.linkedContent: I always surrender myself to language: give credit to that which is to come (as opposed to the given)

MONL.content: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi
MONL.linkedContent: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi

OOG.content: “unity is still to come on the basis of what is announced in its origin”
OOG.linkedContent: “unity is still to come on the basis of what is announced in its origin”

OOG.content: phenomenology never had to learn that Thought would always be to come
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenology never had to learn that Thought would always be to come

FK.content: “the future tolerates neither foresight nor providence”
no to-come w/out iterability, w/out heritage & possibility of repeating, w/out messianic memory and promise, messiancity more originary than all messianism
FK.linkedContent: no to-come w/out iterability, w/out heritage & possibility of repeating, w/out messianic memory and promise, messiancity more originary than all messianism

FK.content: no promise w/out promise of a confirmation of the yes [yes, yes]
FK.linkedContent: no promise w/out promise of a confirmation of the yes [yes, yes]

FL.content: justice is infinite because irreducible, irreducible because owed to the other before any contract, parce qu’elle est venue (because it has come, because it is a coming)
FL.linkedContent: justice is infinite because irreducible, irreducible because owed to the other before any contract, parce qu’elle est venue (because it has come, because it is a coming)

FL.content: rigorously distinguish “to-come” from future, which loses openness, loses coming of other, w/out which there’s no justice, la justice reste à venir, elle a à venir, elle est à-venir
FL.linkedContent: rigorously distinguish “to-come” from future, which loses openness, loses coming of other, w/out which there’s no justice, la justice reste à venir, elle a à venir, elle est à-venir

H.content: entering is crossing the threshold, not only approaching or coming
H.linkedContent: entering is crossing the threshold, not only approaching or coming

H.content: p. anne 76 future, the absolutely surprising of what comes from the other
H.linkedContent: p. anne 76 future, the absolutely surprising of what comes from the other

AF.content: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)
AF.linkedContent: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)

AF.content: affirmation of future to-come is affirmation itself, condition of all promises
AF.linkedContent: affirmation of future to-come is affirmation itself, condition of all promises

AF.content: no history or archive of the future to come [respect the future to come of the future to come]
AF.linkedContent: no history or archive of the future to come [respect the future to come of the future to come]

AF.content: affirmation of affirmation, yes, yes, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”
AF.linkedContent: affirmation of affirmation, yes, yes, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”

AF.content: is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]
AF.linkedContent: is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]

AF.content: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive
AF.linkedContent: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive

AF.content: in the structure of future to to-come
AF.linkedContent: in the structure of future to to-come

SPOM.content: the proper of a proper name will always remain to come
SPOM.linkedContent: the proper of a proper name will always remain to come

SPOM.content: opening of the future is its memory (p.45)
democracy to-come not a future of democracy
SPOM.linkedContent: democracy to-come not a future of democracy

SPOM.content: undetermined messianic hope, ce rapport eschatologique à l’avenir, at heart of democracy and communism, concept[s] or promise[s] that arise in a diastema (“out of joint”), a “to come” in future present, not a Kantian regulating idea that would retain future modality of the living present
SPOM.linkedContent: undetermined messianic hope, ce rapport eschatologique à l’avenir, at heart of democracy and communism, concept[s] or promise[s] that arise in a diastema (“out of joint”), a “to come” in future present, not a Kantian regulating idea that would retain future modality of the living present

SPOM.content: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it
SPOM.linkedContent: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it

EM.content: btwn 2 eves (veilles), 2 ends, of man: 1) the guard mounted around the house (la garde montée auprès de la maison) 2) awakening to the day that is coming (l’éveil au jour qui vient)
EM.linkedContent: btwn 2 eves (veilles), 2 ends, of man: 1) the guard mounted around the house (la garde montée auprès de la maison) 2) awakening to the day that is coming (l’éveil au jour qui vient)

VM.content: philosophy’s wellspring (ressource) is its death, nonphilosophy, because of its death it has a future, the future has a future
VM.linkedContent: philosophy’s wellspring (ressource) is its death, nonphilosophy, because of its death it has a future, the future has a future

OH.content: democracy to-come not a Kantian regulative idea, not a certain future, but democracy that has structure of promise > memory of that which carries the to-come here and now
OH.linkedContent: democracy to-come not a Kantian regulative idea, not a certain future, but democracy that has structure of promise > memory of that which carries the to-come here and now

S.content: spirit as revenant, founds history as breath of something it cannot name, return to what is to-come in Hölderlin, the poet must preserve this experience in his Gemüt
S.linkedContent: spirit as revenant, founds history as breath of something it cannot name, return to what is to-come in Hölderlin, the poet must preserve this experience in his Gemüt

VP.content: differance thought prior to or from presence tells us to interrogate presence w/in closure of knowledge > it must also be thought otherwise: dans l’ouverture d’une question inouïe n’ouvrant ni sur un savoir ni sur un non-savoir comme savoir à venir, approaching that on basis of which sa clôture announces/decides itself: openness of this question doesn’t belong to system of vouloir-dire
VP.linkedContent: differance thought prior to or from presence tells us to interrogate presence w/in closure of knowledge > it must also be thought otherwise: dans l’ouverture d’une question inouïe n’ouvrant ni sur un savoir ni sur un non-savoir comme savoir à venir, approaching that on basis of which sa clôture announces/decides itself: openness of this question doesn’t belong to system of vouloir-dire

PAS.content: event, going-to-come rather than a coming-and-going (aller-venir plutôt que va-et-vient)
PAS.linkedContent: event, going-to-come rather than a coming-and-going (aller-venir plutôt que va-et-vient)

POOF.content: philosophers of the future (l‘avenir) will be both figure & responsibility of fundamentally other, because they already are philosophers capable of thinking the future, those capable of enduring the undecidable, terrifying (unlike metaphysicians allergic to perhaps), they are like the Messiah, we are their friends, their herald & precursors (ihre Herolde und Vorlaufer)
POOF.linkedContent: philosophers of the future (l‘avenir) will be both figure & responsibility of fundamentally other, because they already are philosophers capable of thinking the future, those capable of enduring the undecidable, terrifying (unlike metaphysicians allergic to perhaps), they are like the Messiah, we are their friends, their herald & precursors (ihre Herolde und Vorlaufer)

POOF.content: the to-come disjoins itself, disjoins the self that would yet join itself in this disjunction > to-come more ‘ancient,’ ‘older,’ than the present [see p. 28 excess of Nietzsche’s “all too”]
POOF.linkedContent: the to-come disjoins itself, disjoins the self that would yet join itself in this disjunction > to-come more ‘ancient,’ ‘older,’ than the present [see p. 28 excess of Nietzsche’s “all too”]

POOF.content: ‘perhaps,’ announcement of 1st act, 1st scene: only chance granted to the future, chance of chance
POOF.linkedContent: ‘perhaps,’ announcement of 1st act, 1st scene: only chance granted to the future, chance of chance

POOF.content: future is not just the new, but the work of the arch-ancient, repetition
POOF.linkedContent: future is not just the new, but the work of the arch-ancient, repetition

POOF.content: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible
POOF.linkedContent: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible

POOF.content: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis
POOF.linkedContent: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis

POOF.content: democracy remains to come, this is its essence, indefinitely perfectible, always insufficient & future > even when there is democracy, it never exists
POOF.linkedContent: democracy remains to come, this is its essence, indefinitely perfectible, always insufficient & future > even when there is democracy, it never exists

SH.content: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be opened like a door to “who” would come] like a wound? yes and no
SH.linkedContent: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be opened like a door to “who” would come] like a wound? yes and no

FWT.content: what comes?: what calls upon & overwhelms my responsibility, responsibility before my freedom, freedom w/out autonomy
FWT.linkedContent: what comes?: what calls upon & overwhelms my responsibility, responsibility before my freedom, freedom w/out autonomy

ATIA.content: we’ll have to move continuously along the coming & going btwn the oldest & what is coming > the “again (de nouveau)” and “anew (à nouveau)” of repetition
ATIA.linkedContent: we’ll have to move continuously along the coming & going btwn the oldest & what is coming > the “again (de nouveau)” and “anew (à nouveau)” of repetition

SW.content: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it
SW.linkedContent: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it

SW.content: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation
SW.linkedContent: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation

SW.content: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read
SW.linkedContent: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read

WAP.content: autos of self foundation, never present, but not nothing, it is not the future but structure of promise to come
WAP.linkedContent: autos of self foundation, never present, but not nothing, it is not the future but structure of promise to come

DPi.content: to be against DP is to be against calculation, calculable decidability of you will die on such and such a day > no future w/ anticipation of calculable instant > “my life” must keep a relation to the coming of the other as coming of the to-come (venue de l’à-venir)
DPi.linkedContent: to be against DP is to be against calculation, calculable decidability of you will die on such and such a day > no future w/ anticipation of calculable instant > “my life” must keep a relation to the coming of the other as coming of the to-come (venue de l’à-venir)

PIO.content: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures
PIO.linkedContent: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures

PIO.content: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come
PIO.linkedContent: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come

PF.content: injunction “it is necessary” of future-to-come can receive indifferently names “event” and “other” > irreducible to calculation, program, project, subject, object, anticipation
PF.linkedContent: injunction “it is necessary” of future-to-come can receive indifferently names “event” and “other” > irreducible to calculation, program, project, subject, object, anticipation

AFR.content: Condillac: the science Aristotle called ζητουμéνη (desired, sought after) is the general knowledge of soul on which all sciences depend (what science of happiness is to the arts), this science opens future, providence—so wise man is not stuck in present
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: the science Aristotle called ζητουμéνη (desired, sought after) is the general knowledge of soul on which all sciences depend (what science of happiness is to the arts), this science opens future, providence—so wise man is not stuck in present

TN.content: “consentement exaspéré,” un salut exespéré (ex-hoped for salvation), un salut juste à venir (a just salut to come, a salut just on its way…), un salut sans salvation, worthy of the name
TN.linkedContent: “consentement exaspéré,” un salut exespéré (ex-hoped for salvation), un salut juste à venir (a just salut to come, a salut just on its way…), un salut sans salvation, worthy of the name

CF.content: a politics that would respect the secret (that which exceeds the political or is no longer in juridical domain): democracy to come
CF.linkedContent: a politics that would respect the secret (that which exceeds the political or is no longer in juridical domain): democracy to come

OG.content: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])
OG.linkedContent: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])

OG.content: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]
OG.linkedContent: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]

UWC.content: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come
UWC.linkedContent: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come

UWC.content: Nietzsche’s promising animal (the figure of man) is still to-come
UWC.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s promising animal (the figure of man) is still to-come

EU.content: perhaps impossible, think responsibility as l’interpellation requiring response, beyond juridico-egological form, encore à venir, plus “jeune” (younger, still to come)
EU.linkedContent: perhaps impossible, think responsibility as l’interpellation requiring response, beyond juridico-egological form, encore à venir, plus “jeune” (younger, still to come)
